title: Luxury sales travel consultant | Buying Business Travel
text:
0 comments BBT Tue, 29 Sep 2015 12:54 Follow @BBT_online Employer type:  Recruitment agency Hours:  Full time Job category:  Business Travel Location:  Greater London Region:  England, London Salary range:  Undisclosed Our client was founded with the mission of delivering the highest level of service to their exclusive network of corporate and leisure clients. This is an exciting opportunity to work for an ever-growing, luxury corporate travel management company, creating bespoke European and Worldwide travel experiences for the discerning clientele. 

This cutting edge travel company has built an extensive travel global network over the past 20 years based on its in-depth understanding of its clients’ needs, enabling them to offer a completely tailored travel experience, with destinations ranging across all continents. 

This exciting travel opportunity includes a vast array of responsibilities in which you will learn something new every day. Our client is looking for a travel candidate from a corporate or leisure travel background with worldwide travel sales experience, preferably in creating luxury tailor-made trips for corporate and leisure clients. 

Responsibilities:
• You will be the principal point of contact for your clients, managing every stage of the sales, after-sales and travel experience
• Dealing with incoming calls and emails, creating both leisure and corporate itineraries for VIP clients
• Offering a cutting edge customer service to the discerning clientele
• Arranging flights, bespoke hotels, airport lounges, car hire, events, airport parking – generally offering a concierge service 

What are we looking for?
• Strong verbal, written and presentation skills 
• Have a proven track record of securing sales in a customer-focused environment within the travel industry, i.e. business travel, tour operator or travel agency
• Well travelled
• Target driven
• Clear telephone manner 
• You must be GDS competent ideally Galileo, however cross training is provided and knowledge of Dolphin back office systems
• Ability to build a rapport with clients, effective time management and customer service skills
• Manage to work under pressure and deal with crisis management

Benefits:
• Potential to earn up to 50K per annum
• Uncapped commission 
• Travel perks
• Sociable office hours, Mon-Fri
• Pension
• High spec working environment
• Opportunity to work within a friendly team

Interested?
This is an opportunity that you certainly cannot miss. If you’re looking for a new and exciting travel role with a dynamic travel company, then click here
